name: places/ChIJf4wa8rtYwokRng-IdX06Umc
adrFormatAddress: 1615 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA

originalText.text:
This is a great spot, i don’t know what the negative reviewers are talking about. The place is small and not fancy but is clean and quiet. I had 60 minutes of bodywork and cupping done today and my back feels MUCH better. My therapist was very thorough but made sure he wasn’t hurting me too badly. I already have better range of motion in my neck which is pretty exciting! Definitely the best bodywork massage I’ve ever had, I’ll be back!
…
Updated a month or so later, my review still stands after being here around 5 times. Some masseuses are better than others but I’ve only had a good experience here.

originalText.text: I had the best experience for my hour back massage! It was true to price at $55. She really focused on where I was tense and took the time to realign me. I really loved my masseuse! I can’t wait to come back!

text.text: I had the best experience for my hour back massage! It was true to price at $55. She really focused on where I was tense and took the time to realign me. I really loved my masseuse! I can’t wait to come back!

originalText.text: I’m not one to bring down a local spot. But this place is the worst spot I’ve been to. The massage itself was sub-par. On several instances it felt like friction burn. In addition to that when I went to pay, the receptionist said its 4 additional dollars for card (which I understand. Many places charge that). And then she said that oh no actually all the cards you’re trying to pay with charge $5. She then also proceeded to bully me into tipping 20% by saying it’s what the state of NY mandates. I had too severe of a migraine to argue. I think I would know what I can afford to tip based on my finances and the service I received. If I could give negative stars, I would.

I had too severe of a migraine to argue. I think I would know what I can afford to tip based on my finances and the service I received. If I could give negative stars, I would.

originalText.text: I wish I would have read the reviews. This was the worst massage and experience I could imagine. He said nothing. He was grunting. I told him it was painful. He did not ease up on the pressure. I am in so much pain I had to take medication tonight. And above all, he had the audacity to ask for a higher tip. Please avoid this place at all costs.

text.text: I wish I would have read the reviews. This was the worst massage and experience I could imagine. He said nothing. He was grunting. I told him it was painful. He did not ease up on the pressure. I am in so much pain I had to take medication tonight. And above all, he had the audacity to ask for a higher tip. Please avoid this place at all costs.

originalText.text: Typical NYC Chinese massage place, what was not typical was the high pressure tip "request"... not sure when almost 30% tip became the going tip rate, but in addition to the over 7% credit  card fee, was pretty unhappy with my masseuse INSISTING on more than 20% tip? I'm happy to over tip for exceptional or over the top service - this was standard service. I DO NOT recommend and I will not be returning. This whole tip culture thing is becoming exhausting.
